result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Wayne Hanson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
AND PLEA AND SENTENCING 8:31 AM Defendant Joshua Wayne Hanson in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Joshua Wayne Hanson.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. State indicates agreement has been reached. Defendant will plead to sole count, State moves to amend count 1 and drop the repeater. State recommends 9 months jail consecutive to all other cases, imposed and stay for 2 years probation, conditions 42 days jail with 42 days credit (time served), Doc programming, and $50 fine plus costs. 
Court amends charge. Defendant pleads no contest to the amended charge. Attorney Hoffman stipulates to a factual basis. Court finds the defendant's plea is knowingly and voluntarily made. Court accepts the defendant's plea, judgment of conviction is entered and defendant is found guilty. State makes statement, refers to defendant's prior criminal history. Indicates the defendant does well on supervision. 
Court orders 9 months jail consecutive to any other sentences, imposed and stay for 2 years probation, conditions 42 days jail with 42 days credit (time served), DOC programming, and $50 fine plus costs. 120 days to pay.

2:18 PM Prosecuting attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joshua Wayne Hanson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman appeared by video for Joshua Wayne Hanson. State acknowledges receipt of bail modification motion. Attorney Hoffman indicates that defendant is a lifelong resident of Bayfield county with family in that county. Was initially on probation hold but the hold has now been lifted. Can post up to $500 cash. State opposes modification. Recites defendant's prior criminal history, probation revocations, and previous bail jumping charges. Court denies motion for bail modification.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
